entry.value: ${filename}|${now():format("dd-MM-yyyy.HH:mm:ss")}|ERROR|Error while getting the attributes from conf file|${errors}

import requests import json import time from datetime import datetime from org.apache.nifi.processor.io import OutputStreamCallback #here is the command to take the flowfile from the queue flowfile = session.get()
#sometimes the script cant take the flowfile so im doing this if if (flowfile != None): #getting the flowfile attributes - its coming with square-brackets so i'm getting rid of them with [1:-1] they are all strings URL = "https://illinhdpmdev02.corp.amdocs.com:21443" data_source=flowfile.getAttribute('data_source') column_name=flowfile.getAttribute('column_name') column_type=flowfile.getAttribute('column_type') file_path=flowfile.getAttribute('file_path') #to be able to work with each atrribute in the column lists i'm casting those strings to lists column_name= json.loads(column_name) column_type= json.loads(column_type) file_type=flowfile.getAttribute('file_type').upper()
table_name=flowfile.getAttribute('table_name') hdfs_path=flowfile.getAttribute('hdfs_path') cols=[] #objects declaration to future parts of the script guids={} guid_list=[] bulk_json=[]
#the headers for the post command - it is mandatory post_headers = { 'Content-Type': 'application/json;charset=UTF-8', 'Accept': 'application/json;charset=UTF-8' }
leng = len(column_name)
# running on every column and creating the proper json to the atlas insertion try: for colNum in range(0,len(column_name)): json_to_Atlas = { "typeName": "DbColumnType", "createTime": int(time.time() * 1000), "modifiedTime": int(time.time() * 1000), "attributes": { "name": column_name[colNum], "owner":"nifi", "type": json.dumps(column_type[colNum]), "position": colNum+1, "qualifiedName": column_name[colNum] + "_" + table_name + "_" + data_source } } bulk_json.append(json_to_Atlas)
bulk_json = {"entities": bulk_json} bulk_json = json.dumps(bulk_json, ensure_ascii=False)
# this is the post request r = requests.post(URL+"/api/atlas/v2/entity/bulk", bulk_json,auth=("ozl","qaz1!wsx"), headers=post_headers,verify="/etc/ssl/certs/AmdocsIntermediateCA.PEM") if r.status_code / 100 != 2: json_text = bulk_json raise Exception("Atlas returned code " + str(r.status_code) + " " + r.text)
response_text = r.text
# i'm taking the guids and assigning them as attribute to the flow file to relate the rdbms table to those columns response_text_json = json.loads(response_text) guid_list = [] for guid in response_text_json["guidAssignments"].values(): guid_list.append(guid)
# creating the hdfs_path entity in atlas hdfs_to_atlas = { "entity": { "typeName": "hdfs_path", "createTime": int(time.time() * 1000), "modifiedTime": int(time.time() * 1000), "attributes": { "name": table_name + "_" + data_source, "owner":"nifi", "path": hdfs_path, "qualifiedName": data_source+"_"+file_path+"_"+table_name } } } hdfs_to_atlas = json.dumps(hdfs_to_atlas, ensure_ascii=False) r = requests.post(URL+"/api/atlas/v2/entity", hdfs_to_atlas,auth=("ozl","qaz1!wsx"), headers=post_headers,verify="/etc/ssl/certs/AmdocsIntermediateCA.PEM") if r.status_code / 100 != 2: json_text = hdfs_to_atlas raise Exception("Atlas returned code " +str(r.status_code)+ " " + r.text) # taking the hdfs path guid for the rdbms table hdfs_guid = str(r.text)
# clearing the unneeded content guid_loc = hdfs_guid.find("guidAssignments") + 17 hdfs_guid = hdfs_guid[guid_loc:-1] hdfs_guid = list(json.loads(hdfs_guid, encoding='utf-8').values())
# the rdbms json rdbms_to_atlas = { "entity": { "typeName": "RDBMS_Table", "createTime": int(time.time() * 1000), "modifiedTime": int(time.time() * 1000), "attributes": { "name": table_name, "owner":"nifi", "data_source_type": "FILE", "last_update": int(time.time() * 1000), "qualifiedName": table_name+"_"+data_source, "data_source": { "file_descriptor": { "file_type":file_type , "source_name": data_source }, "source_type": "FILE" }, "hdfs_location": { "typeName": "hdfs_path", "guid": hdfs_guid[0] } } } }
# it is commented because the columns handler is not working right now
for guid in range(0, len(guid_list)): location = {"typeName": "DbColumnType", "guid": str(guid_list[guid])} cols.append(location) rdbms_to_atlas["entity"]["attributes"]["columns"] = cols
rdbms_to_atlas = json.dumps(rdbms_to_atlas, ensure_ascii=False) r = requests.post(URL+"/api/atlas/v2/entity", rdbms_to_atlas,auth=("ozl","qaz1!wsx"), headers=post_headers,verify="/etc/ssl/certs/AmdocsIntermediateCA.PEM") if r.status_code / 100 != 2: json_text = rdbms_to_atlas raise Exception("Atlas returned code " +str(r.status_code)+ " " + r.text)
session.transfer(flowfile, REL_SUCCESS)
except Exception as ERROR: flowfile=session.putAttribute(flowfile,'AtlasError',str(ERROR)) session.transfer(flowfile, REL_FAILURE)

flowFileList = session.get(1000) noOfFiles=flowFileList.size() fileNumber=1 if(!flowFileList.isEmpty()) { flowFileList.each { flowFile -> flowFile = session.putAttribute(flowFile, 'fragment.count', (String)noOfFiles) flowFile = session.putAttribute(flowFile, 'fragment.index', (String)fileNumber) session.transfer(flowFile, REL_SUCCESS) fileNumber++ } }

SELECT 'ISRAEL' as 'Region' ,'Israel' as 'Country' ,case building.Name when 'Karuselot-B' then '7' when 'KenyonRaanana' then '20' when 'Genay-Shefa-BCD' then '7' when 'NPR-KANION' then '20' when 'RaananaNorth' then '422' when null then '9999' when 'CoHodHasharon' then '9999' when 'nprsderot' then '41' when 'Shefa-Lobby' then '7' when 'SderotBr' then '407' when 'NATZERETNEW' then '319' when 'Ganey-shefa-A' then '7' when 'CoHodHasharon' then '61' else 'N/A' end as 'Building Code' ,case building.Name when 'Karuselot-B' then 'Raanana, Ganey Shefa' when 'KenyonRaanana' then 'Raanana, Kenyon' when 'Genay-Shefa-BCD' then 'Raanana, Ganey Shefa' when 'NPR-KANION' then 'Raanana, Kenyon' when 'RaananaNorth' then 'Raanana, North' when null then 'N/A' when 'CoHodHasharon' then 'N/A' when 'nprsderot' then 'Shderot, Shaar Hanegev' when 'Shefa-Lobby' then 'Raanana, Ganey Shefa' when 'SderotBr' then 'Shderot, Negev North' when 'NATZERETNEW' then 'Nazareth, Industrial Park' when 'Ganey-shefa-A' then 'Raanana, Ganey Shefa' when 'CoHodHasharon' then 'Hod Hasharon, Bldg. C' else 'N/A' end as 'Building Name' ,cast (RptEvents.[DateTime] as DATETIME) as 'Timestamp – hour' ,CONVERT (varchar,CONVERT(date, (RptEvents.[DateTime])),1) as 'Timestamp – date' ,RptEvents.IndividualNdx as 'Badge ID' ,people.Custom01 as 'Employee Number' ,people.FirstName as 'Employee First Name' ,people.LastName as 'Employee Last Name' ,RptEvents.DeviceName as 'Reader' ,'' as 'Event description' ,'' as 'Activity type'
FROM INetDB.dbo.RptEvents left join INetDB.dbo.RptIndividuals people on [RptEvents].IndividualNdx = people.IndividualNdx and people.TenantNdx = '1' --AmdocsIsrael left join INetDB.dbo.NetConLink building on left(RptEvents.PointAddress,2) = building.LinkId
where people.Custom01 is not null and people.IamDisabled = 0

flowFileList = session.get(500) noOfFiles=flowFileList.size() fileNumber=1 if(!flowFileList.isEmpty()) { flowFileList.each { flowFile -> flowFile = session.putAttribute(flowFile, 'fragment.count', (String)noOfFiles) flowFile = session.putAttribute(flowFile, 'fragment.index', (String)fileNumber) session.transfer(flowFile, REL_SUCCESS) fileNumber++ } }

try: import json from org.apache.nifi.processor.io import OutputStreamCallback flowfile=session.get() if(flowfile): column_type=flowfile.getAttribute('column_type') column_name=flowfile.getAttribute('column_name') types_dict=flowfile.getAttribute('types_dict') avro_schema=flowfile.getAttribute('avro.schema') logical_types=flowfile.getAttribute('logical_types') column_type=json.loads(column_type) column_name=json.loads(column_name) avro_schema=json.loads(avro_schema) types_dict=json.loads(types_dict) logical_types=json.loads(logical_types) flowfile = session.putAttribute(flowfile, 'old_avro.schema', json.dumps(avro_schema))
for field in avro_schema["fields"]: for col in column_name: if (field['name'] == col): if(column_type[column_name.index(col)] in types_dict): field['type']=["null",types_dict[column_type[column_name.index(col)]]] if(column_type[column_name.index(col)] in logical_types): field['logicalType']=logical_types[column_type[column_name.index(col)]] else: field['type']=["null","string"] break else: continue
flowfile = session.putAttribute(flowfile, 'avro.schema', json.dumps(avro_schema)) session.transfer(flowfile, REL_SUCCESS) except Exception as ERROR: class PyOutputStreamCallback(OutputStreamCallback): def __init__(self): pass def process(self, outputStream): outputStream.write("there has been error at: "+datetime.now().strftime("%Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S")+"message- "+str(ERROR)) flowfile = session.write(flowfile, PyOutputStreamCallback()) session.transfer(flowfile, REL_FAILURE)
SELECT * FROM ALL_TAB_COLUMNS WHERE TABLE_NAME ='${table_name:toUpper()}' AND OWNER='${schema:toUpper()}'
SELECT COLUMN_NAME,DATA_SCALE FROM ALL_TAB_COLUMNS WHERE TABLE_NAME ='${table_name:toUpper()}' AND OWNER='${schema:toUpper()}' AND DATA_TYPE='NUMBER'
